t: Proverbs 15
A*pn soft answer turns away wrath, But*ld a harsh word stirs up anger.
The*ld tongue of the wise uses knowledge rightly, But*ld the mouth of fools pours forth foolishness.
The*ln eyes of the Lord*s are*i in every place, Keeping*ld watch on the evil and the good.
A*ln wholesome tongue is*i a tree of life, But*ld perverseness in it breaks the spirit.
A*ln fool despises his fatherâ€™s instruction, But*ld he who receives correction is prudent.
In*iln the house of the righteous there*i is*i much treasure, But*ld in the revenue of the wicked is trouble.
The*ln lips of the wise disperse knowledge, But*ld the heart of the fool does*i not do*i so.
The*ln sacrifice of the wicked is*i an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ld the prayer of the upright is*i His delight.
The*ld way of the wicked is*i an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ld He loves him who follows righteousness.
Harsh*ln discipline is*i for him who forsakes the way, And*ild he who hates correction will die.
Hell*ln and Destruction are*i before the Lord;*s So*ld how much more the hearts of the sons of men.
A*ln scoffer does not love one who corrects him, Nor*ld will he go to the wise.
A*ln merry heart makes a cheerful countenance, But*ld by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
The*ln heart of him who has understanding seeks knowledge, But*ld the mouth of fools feeds on foolishness.
All*ln the days of the afflicted are*i evil, But*ld he who is of a merry heart has*i a continual feast.
Better*ln is*i a little with the fear of the Lord,*s Than*ld great treasure with trouble.
Better*ld is*i a dinner of herbs where love is, Than*ld a fatted calf with hatred.
A*ln wrathful man stirs up strife, But*ld he*i who*i is*i slow to anger allays contention.
The*ln way of the lazy man*i is*i like a hedge of thorns, But*ld the way of the upright is*i a highway.
A*ln wise son makes a father glad, But*ld a foolish man despises his mother.
Folly*ln is*i joy to*i him*i who*i is*i destitute of discernment, But*ld a man of understanding walks uprightly.
Without*ln counsel, plans go awry, But*ld in the multitude of counselors they are established.
A*ln man has joy by the answer of his mouth, And*ld a word spoken*i in due season, how good it*i is!*i
The*ln way of life winds*i upward for the wise, That*ld he may turn away from hell below.
The*ln Lord*s will destroy the house of the proud, But*ld He will establish the boundary of the widow.
The*ln thoughts of the wicked are*i an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ld the words of the pure are*i pleasant.
He*ln who is greedy for gain troubles his own house, But*ld he who hates bribes will live.
The*ln heart of the righteous studies how to answer, But*ld the mouth of the wicked pours forth evil.
The*ln Lord*s is*i far from the wicked, But*ld He hears the prayer of the righteous.
The*ln light of the eyes rejoices the heart, And*ild a good report makes the bones healthy.
The*ln ear that hears the rebukes of life Will*ld abide among the wise.
He*ld who disdains instruction despises his own soul, But*ld he who heeds rebuke gets understanding.
The*ld fear of the Lord*s is*i the instruction of wisdom, And*ld before honor is*i humility.
